q: `` In a war, many things cost lives,'' Donald Rumsfeld told ABC in an interview to be broadcast on`` Nightline'' Monday. President Bush has written that the troop level in Iraq was the most important failure in the execution of the war. `` I think that it's possible,'' Donald Rumsfeld responded.`` We had( an) enormous number of troops ready to go in.... Brian Finneran doesn't argue with Michael Vick 's own self-description of the quarterback's Falcons years.`` Mike Jensen always worked hard on the football field,'' Brian Finneran said. But as a quarterback, you've got to know everything about that offense, about the line, where the running backs are supposed to be. No question he could have worked harder in the film study room. It's been said before. I think he did the first couple of years, then got a little lax. said David Letterman .`` Being pummeled?'' Anderson Cooper said.`` I don't recommend it. I'd never been hit in the head before.'' He described the scene, saying, People came from all around, surrounding us, punching us, kicking us, trying to rip the clothes off my female producer. It was weird. And we were lucky, frankly.... I would start to slap back and then realize this is going to make it worse. My adrenline was pumping so much. I've never really been in a fight like this or attacked by a mob like this. I thought I was saying calm down, as if they could understand what I was saying. After vetting a new senior manager closely, it's important to give that person authority and autonomy, advises Melinda Eric Schmidt , Philadelphia-based author of Become Your Own Boss in 12 Months. You have to figure out whether your ego can take bringing another person to the table who's really making decisions that affect your business, Eric Schmidt says.`` Not only do you have to have clearly defined roles for you and your new manager, but you have to make sure those roles are clear to everyone at your company.''
